ground_truth: Emily smiles and looks down shyly as Ben shuffles. She gives a little wave as Ben steps outside, and he shoots Emily a last look before shutting the door behind him. Ben goes to his car while Emily watches him through the window. Ben stands, looking out from his patio with breakers crashing on the beach where Sarah waves up to him, and tears roll down Ben's cheeks as he stands looking out to sea. Ben sits on rocks, then opens shutters in his beach house, fingers a rope of pearls, and studies a photo of himself and Sarah. He cleans his beach house, then sits glumly among a stack of packed boxes. Ben drives his car sedately along the wide and winding coast road, bathed in sunshine. At a motel, the receptionist, Larry, helps Ben carry gear to his room, where Ben uses a small hose to fill up a large cylindrical fish tank that Larry was carrying. Light from the tank illuminates Ben's face as he stands in the darkness, seemingly lost in thought. Ben, as a boy, gazes in awe into a tank of jellyfish with spindly, long tentacles; the jellyfish move hypnotically, with the glowing specter-like creatures drifting through the water, as he watches spellbound with his palms pressed against the tank. In the present, Michelle's husband, Dan, watches a box jellyfish in adult Ben's tank as Ben writes, signs a document, throws a notebook at Dan, and taps his own temple. Dan's expression darkens, and he edgily wipes his mouth, then his eyes. He glares at Ben and falters before he starts to speak and paces the motel room tearfully. Ben enters a crowded waiting room full of women and children, standing and staring across at a bespectacled middle-aged woman sitting in a glass-fronted office. Her mouth drops open when she sees him, and Ben waves to her and smiles. The woman hurries out to him, and Holly hugs him tightly before stepping back. Holly keeps a photo of herself and Ben on her desk in the open-plan office. Ben sits with her as Holly's eyes glisten with tears while she stares at him; he eyes her steadily and smiles faintly. She considers and looks at him reassuringly. In a dilapidated area, Ben sits in his car watching a house. Connie cleans a window of the house, and Ben approaches the window and smiles at Connie, who opens the front door but not the wrought iron screen door before letting him in. A little boy of about eight and a slightly older girl are in the living room, playing cards and listening as Ben sits down, and the children listen as they play.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Emily beams and glances downward bashfully as Ben fidgets. She gives a small gesture as Ben steps outdoors, and he shoots Emily a final glance before closing the entrance behind him. Ben proceeds to his automobile while Emily observes him through the pane. Ben stands, gazing out from his terrace with waves crashing on the shore where Sarah gestures up to him, and droplets roll down Ben's cheeks as he stands gazing out to sea. Ben perches on stones, then unlatches shutters in his seaside abode, fingers a string of pearls, and examines a photograph of himself and Sarah. He tidies his beach house, then sits sullenly among a pile of packed crates. Ben drives his vehicle calmly along the broad and serpentine coast highway, bathed in sunlight. At a hostel, the clerk, Larry, assists Ben to convey equipment to his chamber, where Ben employs a small tube to fill up a large cylindrical aquarium that Larry was carrying. Light from the aquarium illuminates Ben's visage as he stands in the shadow, seemingly lost in contemplation. Ben, as a lad, gazes in wonder into a tank of jellyfish with spindly, long tentacles; the jellyfish move mesmerizingly, with the glowing ghost-like creatures drifting through the water, as he watches spellbound with his palms pressed against the tank. In the present, Michelle's spouse, Dan, observes a box jellyfish in adult Ben's tank as Ben scribbles, signs a paper, tosses a notebook at Dan, and taps his own forehead. Dan's expression clouds, and he nervously wipes his mouth, then his eyes. He glowers at Ben and hesitates before he begins to speak and strides the motel chamber sorrowfully. Ben enters a crowded waiting chamber full of women and children, standing and staring across at a bespectacled middle-aged woman sitting in a glass-fronted office. Her mouth drops open when she sees him, and Ben gestures to her and beams. The woman rushes out to him, and Holly embraces him tightly before stepping back. Holly keeps a photograph of herself and Ben on her workstation in the open-plan office. Ben sits with her as Holly's eyes glisten with tears while she stares at him; he watches her steadily and smiles faintly. She considers and looks at him reassuringly. In a dilapidated neighborhood, Ben sits in his automobile watching a dwelling. Connie wipes a pane of the house, and Ben approaches the pane and beams at Connie, who opens the front entrance but not the wrought iron screen entrance before letting him in. A little boy of about eight and a slightly older girl are in the living space, playing cards and listening as Ben sits down, and the children listen as they play.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Emily shyly smiles as Ben shuffles outside, giving her a final look before closing the door. Watching from the window, Emily sees Ben head to his car. Ben stands on his patio, looking at the sea where Sarah waves, tears streaming down his cheeks. He sits on rocks, opens beach house shutters, fingers pearls, and studies a photo of him and Sarah. After cleaning his beach house, he sits among packed boxes. Ben drives his car leisurely along a sunlit coast road. At a motel, receptionist Larry helps Ben carry gear to his room, where Ben fills a large fish tank. The tank's light illuminates Ben's thoughtful face in the darkness. As a boy, Ben gazed in awe at jellyfish with spindly tentacles. In the present, Dan watches Ben's box jellyfish. Ben writes, signs a document, and throws a notebook at Dan, who wipes his mouth and eyes, pacing the room tearfully. In a crowded waiting room, Ben waves to a middle-aged woman, Holly, who reacts with surprise. She hugs Ben tightly. Holly keeps a photo of them on her desk, and they sit together as her eyes glisten with tears. In a dilapidated area, Ben watches a house. Connie cleans a window and opens the front door, letting Ben in. Inside, a young boy and slightly older girl play cards, listening as Ben sits down.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Emily shyly smiles and waves as Ben steps outside, watching him through the window. On his patio, Ben gazes at the sea and tears up as Sarah waves from the beach. He reminisces, handling a rope of pearls and a photo with Sarah, then cleans his beach house, glumly surrounded by packed boxes. Driving along a sunny coast, he reaches a motel where Larry helps him with gear, and Ben fills a fish tank. In the dark, the tank's light illuminates his thoughtful face. As a boy, Ben was mesmerized by jellyfish in a tank. Now, Dan watches a box jellyfish in Ben's tank. Ben signs a document, throws a notebook at Dan, taps his temple, and Dan reacts emotionally. At a crowded waiting room, a woman, Holly, sees Ben, they embrace, and she keeps a photo of them on her desk. Ben sits with her as she tears up, Ben smiles faintly, and Holly reassures him. In a run-down area, Ben watches a house, smiles at Connie, and enters. Inside, an eight-year-old boy and his older sister play cards and listen as Ben joins them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Emily, with a shy and warm smile, glances downwards as Ben shifts uncomfortably on his feet. She lifts her hand, offering a small wave, as Ben takes a step outside. He gives Emily one last lingering look before he gently closes the door behind him. Moving towards his car, Ben is aware of Emily's eyes following his every move through the window. Meanwhile, Ben stands firmly on his patio, the sound of waves crashing on the beach echoing in the distance. Sarah, standing on the beach, waves up to him, prompting tears to roll down Ben's cheeks as he remains standing, gazing out toward the endless sea. 

Later, Ben finds himself seated on the rugged rocks, and he proceeds to open the shutters of his beach house. His fingers gently trace over a rope of pearls as he studies a photograph of himself alongside Sarah. After cleaning his beach house, Ben sits amidst a clutter of packed boxes, looking particularly glum. He then drives his car at a calm and steady pace along the wide, winding road that hugs the sunlit coast. When he arrives at a motel, the receptionist, Larry, kindly assists Ben by helping to carry his gear to his room. Inside, Ben uses a small hose to carefully fill a large cylindrical fish tank that Larry had been carrying. The illuminating light from the tank casts a glow on Ben's face as he stands in the dimly lit room, appearing deeply lost in his thoughts.

As a young boy, Ben would gaze in awe at a tank filled with jellyfish, each with long, spindly tentacles. The jellyfish moved in a hypnotic dance, the glowing creatures drifting specter-like through the water, as Ben watched in a spellbound state, his palms pressed firmly against the tank. In the present time, Michelle's husband, Dan, studies a box jellyfish swimming in Ben's tank as the adult Ben writes and signs a document. Ben then hurls a notebook towards Dan and taps on his own temple. Dan's face darkens with emotion, and he nervously wipes his mouth and his eyes. He glares at Ben, hesitates, and then begins to speak. His pacing fills the motel room, his tears evident.

Ben steps into a crowded waiting room filled with women and children. He stands there, staring across the room at a bespectacled middle-aged woman seated in a glass-fronted office. Her mouth drops open in surprise at the sight of him. Ben waves and smiles warmly. The woman quickly makes her way over to him, and Holly embraces him tightly before stepping back. On her desk in the open-plan office, Holly keeps a treasured photo of herself with Ben. Seated together, Holly's eyes glisten with unshed tears as she gazes at him; Ben returns her look steadily, offering a faint, reassuring smile. She considers him thoughtfully and looks at him with reassurance.

In a run-down area, Ben sits quietly in his car, keeping watch over a house. Connie can be seen cleaning one of the windows, and as Ben approaches, he smiles warmly at her. She opens the front door, pausing at the wrought iron screen door before letting Ben inside. Inside the living room, an eight-year-old boy and a slightly older girl are engaged in playing cards. As Ben takes a seat, the children continue their game, listening intently to the conversation as they play.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Emily, wearing a shy yet warm smile, glances downwards, her gaze soft and uncertain, as Ben shifts uncomfortably from foot to foot. With a gentle lift of her hand, she offers a small, heartfelt wave, while Ben takes a deliberate step towards the outside world. He turns back, giving Emily one last, lingering glance before he softly closes the door behind him, sealing the moment. As he moves towards his car, Ben is acutely aware of Emily's eyes tracking his every movement through the window's transparent pane. Meanwhile, he stands with a firm stance on his patio, where the distant, rhythmic sound of waves crashing on the beach echoes in the background. Sarah, standing gracefully on the sandy beach, waves up towards him with a gesture that prompts tears to cascade down Ben's cheeks, his eyes fixed on the endless, majestic sea before him.

Later, Ben finds himself seated thoughtfully on the rugged, weathered rocks by the shore, and he proceeds to open the wooden shutters of his quaint beach house. His fingers begin to gently trace over a delicate, shimmering rope of pearls as he carefully studies a cherished photograph of himself next to Sarah. After tidying and cleaning his beach house, Ben sits amid a clutter of hastily packed boxes, looking particularly glum and introspective. He then drives his car at a calm and steady pace along the wide, winding coastal road that hugs the sunlit, scenic coast. Upon his arrival at a modest motel, the receptionist, Larry, kindly offers his assistance by helping carry Ben's gear to his assigned room. Inside the room, Ben uses a small hose to carefully fill a large, cylindrical fish tank that Larry had been carrying with him. The illuminating light emanating from the fish tank casts a gentle, calming glow on Ben's face as he stands there in the dimly lit room, appearing deeply lost in his swirling thoughts.

As a young boy, Ben would gaze in awe and wonder at a mesmerizing tank filled with jellyfish, each with long, spindly tentacles that seemed to dance. The jellyfish moved in a hypnotic, fluid dance, the glowing creatures drifting specter-like through the water, while young Ben watched in a spellbound state, his small palms pressed firmly against the transparent tank. In the present time, Michelle's husband, Dan, intently studies a box jellyfish swimming gracefully in Ben's tank as adult Ben writes and thoughtfully signs a document. Ben then impulsively hurls a notebook towards Dan and taps insistently on his own temple. Dan's face darkens with a mix of emotions, and he nervously wipes his mouth and his teary eyes. He glares at Ben, hesitates, and then begins to speak with a mixture of tension and emotion. His pacing fills the confined space of the motel room, his tears plainly evident.

Ben steps into a bustling waiting room filled with women and children. He stands there quietly, staring across the room at a bespectacled, middle-aged woman seated in a glass-fronted office. Her mouth drops open in shock and surprise at the unexpected sight of him. Ben waves and smiles warmly with genuine affection. The woman quickly makes her way over to him, and Holly embraces him tightly before stepping back. On her desk in the open-plan office, Holly keeps a treasured photo of herself with Ben, a testament to their connection. Seated together, Holly's eyes glisten with unshed tears as she gazes deeply at him, while Ben returns her look steadily, offering a faint yet reassuring smile. She considers him thoughtfully and offers him a reassuring look, full of understanding.

In a run-down, neglected area, Ben sits quietly in his car, keeping a watchful eye over an old house. Connie can be seen diligently cleaning one of the windows, and as Ben approaches, he smiles warmly at her, conveying familiarity and kindness. She opens the front door, pausing momentarily at the wrought iron screen door before she finally lets Ben inside. Inside the cozy living room, an eight-year-old boy and a slightly older girl are deeply engrossed in playing cards together. As Ben takes a seat, the children continue their engaging game, listening intently to the ongoing conversation as they play, fully absorbed in both activities.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Emily stands before Ben, she smiles warmly, her gaze falling shyly to the floor as Ben, feeling the weight of the moment, shuffles awkwardly. Emily lifts her hand in a gentle, hesitant wave, and Ben, with determination, steps outside, casting one last, lingering look back at Emily before he firmly shuts the door behind him. Outside, Ben proceeds towards his car, while Emily, unable to look away, follows his movements through the window. Transitioning to another scene, Ben stands motionless on his patio, his eyes fixed on the beach where the breakers crash against the shore, noticing Sarah waving up to him. As the realization sinks in, tears begin to stream down Ben's cheeks as he remains rooted on the spot, his gaze lost to the expansive sea. Seeking solace, he finds a place on the rocks, opening the shutters of his beach house to let the light flood in. He gently fingers a rope of pearls, taking a moment to study a cherished photo of himself and Sarah, allowing memories to wash over him. In an effort to distract himself, Ben dedicates time to cleaning his beach house, only to sit dejectedly among the stacks of packed boxes, feeling the weight of each decision. Later, in the comforting embrace of sunshine, Ben drives his car with deliberate calm along the wide, winding coast road. Upon reaching a motel, he meets Larry, the receptionist, who kindly assists him in carrying his gear to the room. Inside, Ben meticulously attaches a small hose to fill up a large cylindrical fish tank that Larry had helped transport, watching as the light from the tank casts an ethereal glow on his face, leaving him deep in thought. His mind drifts back to boyhood, to a moment of wonder as he gazes into a tank filled with jellyfish, observing their spindly, long tentacles as they move hypnotically, the glowing specter-like creatures mesmerizing him as he presses his palms against the glass in awe. In the present, Michelle's husband, Dan, is fixated on a box jellyfish in adult Ben's tank. Meanwhile, Ben, lost in work, writes and signs a document before abruptly tossing a notebook at Dan, tapping his temple with an air of urgency. Dan's demeanor shifts, his expression darkening as he anxiously wipes his mouth and eyes while glaring at Ben. Faltering, he begins to speak, his voice thick with emotion, and paces the motel room tearfully, overcome by the intensity of the moment. In another scene, Ben enters a bustling waiting room teeming with women and children, his eyes locking onto a middle-aged woman with glasses seated in a glass-fronted office. Her mouth falls open in surprise upon seeing him, prompting Ben to wave and smile warmly. She swiftly exits her office to greet him, and Holly embraces Ben tightly before releasing him. Holly maintains a photo of Ben and herself on her desk within the open-plan office, signifying their bond. They then sit together as Holly's eyes glisten with unshed tears, her gaze transfixed on Ben, who returns her look with a steady, faint smile. She contemplates the moment, offering him a reassuring look. Later, in a dilapidated neighborhood, Ben sits in his car, watching a house with a sense of anticipation. As Connie cleans a window of the house, Ben approaches, smiling warmly at her. She opens the front door, though not the wrought iron screen door, before eventually allowing him inside. Inside the living room, a little boy around eight and a slightly older girl are engrossed in a card game. As Ben joins them, the children continue to play, listening intently to what's being shared, captivated by the presence of this visitor in their lives.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Emily smiles shyly at Ben, who gives her a wave before leaving. As Ben heads to his car, Emily watches from the window. On his patio, Ben gazes mournfully at the sea where Sarah is, tears streaming down his face. In his beach house, Ben reflects on memories with Sarah, handling a pearl necklace and a photo of them together. After cleaning the house, he sits among packed boxes before driving along the coast. At a motel, Larry assists Ben with his gear, including a fish tank Ben sets up in his room, where he stands lost in thought. In a flashback, young Ben is mesmerized by jellyfish in a tank. In the present, Dan observes a box jellyfish in Ben's tank as Ben signs a document, then expresses frustration by throwing a notebook at Dan, who reacts emotionally. Ben later enters a waiting room, greeting Holly warmly; they share a heartfelt reunion. Holly, who keeps a photo of them on her desk, tears up during their conversation. In a run-down area, Ben watches a house before being welcomed by Connie. Inside, he joins two children playing cards, listening intently to Ben as they play.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Emily smiles and looks down shyly as Ben shuffles, their long-standing friendship coloring every gesture. She gives a little wave as Ben, who has recently been contemplating a significant life change, steps outside, and he shoots Emily a last look before shutting the door behind him. Ben goes to his car, a vintage model he's had since college, while Emily watches him through the window, her thoughts lingering on their shared past. Ben stands, looking out from his patio located on a cliffside, offering a stunning view of the Pacific Ocean, with breakers crashing on the beach where Sarah, his childhood friend, waves up to him, and tears roll down Ben's cheeks as he stands looking out to sea, a place that has always been a sanctuary for him in troubled times. Ben sits on rocks, then opens shutters in his beach house, an inheritance from his late father, fingers a rope of pearls that belonged to his grandmother, and studies a photo of himself and Sarah, taken during a summer carnival. He cleans his beach house, which has been in disarray since he decided to move, then sits glumly among a stack of packed boxes, each labeled with destinations he's considering for a fresh start. Ben drives his car sedately along the wide and winding coast road, renowned for its scenic beauty and numerous lookout points, bathed in sunshine. At a motel, the receptionist, Larry, a retired fisherman who works there part-time, helps Ben carry gear to his room, where Ben uses a small hose to fill up a large cylindrical fish tank that Larry was carrying, an unusual request that piqued Larry’s curiosity. Light from the tank, containing vibrant, colorful fish native to the region, illuminates Ben's face as he stands in the darkness, seemingly lost in thought about his next steps. Ben, as a boy, gazes in awe into a tank of jellyfish at a marine museum, with spindly, long tentacles; the jellyfish move hypnotically, with the glowing specter-like creatures drifting through the water, as he watches spellbound with his palms pressed against the tank. In the present, Michelle's husband, Dan, watches a box jellyfish in adult Ben's tank, a species known for its venomous sting, as Ben writes, signs a document, throws a notebook at Dan, and taps his own temple, signaling an epiphany. Dan's expression darkens, and he edgily wipes his mouth, then his eyes, remembering their last heated discussion about Ben’s impulsive actions. He glares at Ben and falters before he starts to speak and paces the motel room tearfully, struggling with feelings of betrayal. Ben enters a crowded waiting room full of women and children seeking legal aid, standing and staring across at a bespectacled middle-aged woman sitting in a glass-fronted office, who has a reputation for her fierce advocacy. Her mouth drops open when she sees him, and Ben waves to her and smiles. The woman hurries out to him, revealing herself to be Holly, his estranged sister, and hugs him tightly before stepping back. Holly keeps a photo of herself and Ben on her desk in the open-plan office, a symbol of reconnection after years apart. Ben sits with her as Holly's eyes glisten with tears while she stares at him; he eyes her steadily and smiles faintly, their silent exchange bridging years of distance. She considers and looks at him reassuringly, contemplating the future of their relationship. In a dilapidated area known for its economic struggles, Ben sits in his car watching a house. Connie cleans a window of the house, a community center she helps run for local youth, and Ben approaches the window and smiles at Connie, who opens the front door but not the wrought iron screen door, a customary precaution, before letting him in. A little boy of about eight and a slightly older girl, both participants in the center’s after-school program, are in the living room, playing cards and listening as Ben sits down, and the children listen as they play, eager for stories of the world beyond their neighborhood.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. a document throws a notebook at Dan and taps his own temple. Dan's expression darkens and he edgily wipes his mouth then his eyes. He glares at Ben and falters before he starts to speak and paces the motel room tearfully. Ben enters a crowded waiting room full of women and children standing and staring across at a bespectacled middleaged woman sitting in a glassfronted office. Her mouth drops open when she sees him and Ben waves to her and smiles. The woman hurries out to him and Holly hugs him tightly before stepping back. Holly keeps a photo of herself and Ben on her desk in the openplan office. Ben sits with her as Holly's eyes glisten with tears while she stares at him. he eyes her steadily and smiles faintly. She considers and looks at him reassuringly. In a dilapidated area Ben sits in his car watching a house. Connie cleans a window of the house and Ben approaches the window and smiles at Connie who opens the front door but not the wrought iron screen door before letting him in. A little boy of about eight and a slightly older girl are in the living room playing cards and listening as Ben sits down and the children listen as they play.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Emily smiles and looks down shyly as Ben shuffles. She gives a little wave as Ben steps outside and he shoots Emily a last look before shutting the door behind him. Ben goes to his car while Emily watches him through the window. Ben stands looking out from his patio with breakers crashing on the beach where Sarah waves up to him and tears roll down Ben's cheeks as he stands looking out to sea. Ben sits on rocks then opens shutters in his beach house fingers a rope of pearls and studies a photo of himself and Sarah. He cleans his beach house then sits glumly among a stack of packed boxes. Ben drives his car sedately along the wide and winding coast road bathed in sunshine. Ben sits with her as Holly's eyes glisten with tears while she stares at him. he eyes her steadily and smiles faintly. She considers and looks at him reassuringly. In a dilapidated area Ben sits in his car watching a house. Connie cleans a window of the house and Ben approaches the window and smiles at Connie who opens the front door but not the wrought iron screen door before letting him in. A little boy of about eight and a slightly older girl are in the living room playing cards and listening as Ben sits down and the children listen as they play.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Oliver chuckles and gazes up boldly as Mia gallops. He gives a brief salute as Mia leaps indoors, and she launches Oliver a final grin before sealing the portal behind her. Mia hurries to her canoe while Oliver observes her through the skylight. Mia stands, gazing out from her porch with geysers bubbling on the meadow where Leo salutes down to her, and giggles burst from Mia's nose as she stands observing the plains. Mia lounges on boulders, then seals shutters in her cabin, fiddles a string of marbles, and examines a painting of herself and Leo. She vacuums her cabin, then lounges joyfully among a heap of unwrapped crates. Mia pedals her scooter briskly along the narrow and meandering mountain trail, drenched in moonlight. At a gazebo, the gardener, Paul, assists Mia in dragging luggage to her suite, where Mia utilizes a small wrench to tighten a large spherical bird cage that Paul was balancing. Light from the cage brightens Mia's feet as she reclines in the shadows, seemingly captivated by memories. Mia, as a child, peers in wonder into a case of seahorses with tiny, short tails; the seahorses dance gracefully, with the shimmering specter-like animals gliding through the lagoon, as she watches mesmerized with her knuckles pressed against the case. In the future, Sarah's uncle, Mark, observes a rainbow trout in young Mia's cage as Mia doodles, stamps a blueprint, tosses a leaflet at Mark, and pats her own chin. Mark's demeanor hardens, and he sheepishly rubs his chin, then his hands. He sneers at Mia and hesitates before he begins to whisper and stomps the suite noisily. Mia darts into a vacant room filled with men and pets, sitting and glancing nearby at a smiling elder gentleman reclining in a metal-sided cubicle. His eyes widen when he notices her, and Mia nods to him and beams. The gentleman strolls over to her, and Lily clasps her loosely before stepping aside. Lily keeps a mural of herself and Mia on her bookshelf in the enclosed studio. Mia stands with him as Lily's cheeks sparkle with glee while she smiles at her; she surveys him coolly and grins broadly. She pauses and glances at her reassuringly. In a bustling village, Mia lounges in her van observing a home. Jerry polishes a mirror of the home, and Mia approaches the entrance and grins at Jerry, who opens the back gate but not the wooden fence before allowing her in. A young girl of about twelve and a much younger boy are in the kitchen, drawing maps and hearing as Mia stands up, and the adults speak as they sketch.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Emily shyly waves at Ben as he leaves, watching him drive away. Ben is then seen reflecting on memories with Sarah, standing on his patio and tearing up as he looks at the sea. He cleans his beach house, fingers a pearl necklace, and examines a photo with Sarah. After packing up, Ben drives along a sunny coast road to a motel, where he sets up a fish tank with receptionist Larry's help. In the dark, the tank's light reflects on Ben as he recalls, as a child, being mesmerized by jellyfish. In the present, a tense encounter with Dan at the motel occurs, involving a box jellyfish, a signed document, and an exchanged notebook. Ben later enters a waiting room, where Holly, a bespectacled middle-aged woman, is surprised and embraces him warmly. She keeps a photo of them on her desk and listens emotionally as Ben visits her. Finally, in a run-down area, Ben watches a house where Connie cleans a window. She lets him in through a screen door, and inside, two children play cards while attentively listening to Ben.
